013package org.apache.juneau.http.header;
014
015import static java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter.*;
016import static java.time.temporal.ChronoUnit.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
019import java.time.*;
020import java.util.*;
021import java.util.function.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.assertions.*;
024
025/**
026 * Category of headers that consist of a single HTTP-date.
027 *
028 * <p>
029 * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
030 * <p class='bcode'>
031 *    If-Modified-Since: Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT
032 * </p>
033 *
034 * <ul class='seealso'>
035 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-rest-common">juneau-rest-common</a>
036 *    <li class='extlink'><a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.html">Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1</a>
037 * </ul>
038 *
039 * @serial exclude
040 */
041public class BasicDateHeader extends BasicHeader {
042
043   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
044   // Static
045   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
046
047   private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
048
049   /**
050    * Static creator.
051    *
052    * @param name The header name.
053    * @param value
054    *    The header value.
055    *    <br>Must be an RFC-1123 formated string (e.g. <js>"Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT"</js>).
056    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
057    * @return A new header bean, or <jk>null</jk> if the value is <jk>null</jk>.
058    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If name is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
059    */
060   public static BasicDateHeader of(String name, String value) {
061      return value == null ? null : new BasicDateHeader(name, value);
062   }
063
064   /**
065    * Static creator.
066    *
067    * @param name The header name.
068    * @param value
069    *    The header value.
070    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
071    * @return A new header bean, or <jk>null</jk> if the value is <jk>null</jk>.
072    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If name is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
073    */
074   public static BasicDateHeader of(String name, ZonedDateTime value) {
075      return value == null ? null : new BasicDateHeader(name, value);
076   }
077
078   /**
079    * Static creator with delayed value.
080    *
081    * <p>
082    * Header value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link #getValue()}.
083    *
084    * @param name The header name.
085    * @param value
086    *    The supplier of the header value.
087    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
088    * @return A new header bean, or <jk>null</jk> if the value is <jk>null</jk>.
089    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If name is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
090    */
091   public static BasicDateHeader of(String name, Supplier<ZonedDateTime> value) {
092      return value == null ? null : new BasicDateHeader(name, value);
093   }
094
095   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
096   // Instance
097   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
098
099   private final ZonedDateTime value;
100   private final Supplier<ZonedDateTime> supplier;
101
102   /**
103    * Constructor.
104    *
105    * @param name The header name.
106    * @param value
107    *    The header value.
108    *    <br>Must be an RFC-1123 formated string (e.g. <js>"Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT"</js>).
109    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
110    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If name is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
111    */
112   public BasicDateHeader(String name, String value) {
113      super(name, value);
114      this.value = isEmpty(value) ? null : ZonedDateTime.from(RFC_1123_DATE_TIME.parse(value.toString())).truncatedTo(SECONDS);
115      this.supplier = null;
116   }
117
118   /**
119    * Constructor.
120    *
121    * @param name The header name.
122    * @param value
123    *    The header value.
124    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
125    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If name is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
126    */
127   public BasicDateHeader(String name, ZonedDateTime value) {
128      super(name, value);
129      this.value = value;
130      this.supplier = null;
131   }
132
133   /**
134    * Constructor with delayed value.
135    *
136    * <p>
137    * Header value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link #getValue()}.
138    *
139    * @param name The header name.
140    * @param value
141    *    The supplier of the header value.
142    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
143    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If name is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
144    */
145   public BasicDateHeader(String name, Supplier<ZonedDateTime> value) {
146      super(name, null);
147      this.value = null;
148      this.supplier = value;
149   }
150
151   @Override /* Header */
152   public String getValue() {
153      ZonedDateTime x = value();
154      return x == null ? null : RFC_1123_DATE_TIME.format(x);
155   }
156
157   /**
158    * Returns the header value as a {@link ZonedDateTime} wrapped in an {@link Optional}.
159    *
160    * @return The header value as a {@link ZonedDateTime} wrapped in an {@link Optional}.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
161    */
162   public Optional<ZonedDateTime> asZonedDateTime() {
163      return optional(value());
164   }
165
166   /**
167    * Returns the header value as a {@link ZonedDateTime}.
168    *
169    * @return The header value as a {@link ZonedDateTime}.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
170    */
171   public ZonedDateTime toZonedDateTime() {
172      return value();
173   }
174
175   /**
176    * Provides the ability to perform fluent-style assertions on this header.
177    *
178    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
179    * <p class='bjava'>
180    *    <jc>// Validates the response body content is not expired.</jc>
181    *    <jv>client</jv>
182    *       .get(<jsf>URL</jsf>)
183    *       .run()
184    *       .getHeader(<js>"Expires"</js>).asDateHeader().assertZonedDateTime().isLessThan(<jk>new</jk> Date());
185    * </p>
186    *
187    * @return A new fluent assertion object.
188    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
189    */
190   public FluentZonedDateTimeAssertion<BasicDateHeader> assertZonedDateTime() {
191      return new FluentZonedDateTimeAssertion<>(value(), this);
192   }
193
194   /**
195    * Return the value if present, otherwise return <c>other</c>.
196    *
197    * <p>
198    * This is a shortened form for calling <c>asZonedDateTime().orElse(<jv>other</jv>)</c>.
199    *
200    * @param other The value to be returned if there is no value present, can be <jk>null</jk>.
201    * @return The value, if present, otherwise <c>other</c>.
202    */
203   public ZonedDateTime orElse(ZonedDateTime other) {
204      ZonedDateTime x = value();
205      return x != null ? x : other;
206   }
207
208   private ZonedDateTime value() {
209      if (supplier != null)
210         return supplier.get();
211      return value;
212   }
213}
